creditline: Proceeds from the 2012 Minneapolis Print and Drawing Fair
description: St. Francis with beard and halo, kneeling with PL knee on a flat rock, arms outstretched, wearing a patched robe; tiny crucified Christ on X-shaped cross in URC, with dotted lines extending from Christ's nail wounds to Francis' hands and feet; detailed landscape with buildings, trees and road; reading seated figure behind Francis in middle ground
marks:
Signature, Date and Inscription

Inscribed in lo bottom center on stone in foreground, in the plate
text: Two years before his death, St. Francis renounced worldly life and went to Mount La Verna. As one of the most inaccessible mountains in Central Italy, the setting provided St. Francis with the ideal place to attain an intimate connection with God while living in solitude. After fasting and praying for forty days, the Saint was visited by an angel who performed Stigmata on the Saint by replicating Christâ€™s crucifixion wounds on his body.
title: Saint Francis of Assisi Receiving the Stigmata
